Job Title: Single Family Seller/Servicer Education Leader - REMOTE

Location: McLean, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Position Overview:

Are you someone with a passion for adult learning? Are you a savvy seasoned leader, able to empower and inspire action from individuals and teams? Do you have experience in the Single-Family mortgage industry, including Origination, Selling & Delivery, and Servicing areas?

As Director of the Single-Family (SF) Seller/Servicer Education Services (SSES) team, you will be supervising a team that designs, develops, and delivers Freddie Mac client-facing learning solutions across the Single-Family business to impact client business outcomes and meet Freddie Mac directives. The team will engage with key business partners to determine and meet client learning needs, develop and report results to senior management, provide subject matter and instructional design expertise, and provide input into a comprehensive “voice of the client” view across the Freddie Mac Seller Engagement department and beyond. Apply now and learn why Freddie Mac is #HomeToMore!

Our Impact:

Freddie Mac’s SSES team provides an outstanding educational experience, supporting external Business Partners across all segments through a portfolio of 500+ learning solutions. In addition to Seller/Servicers, our training audience includes Housing Finance Agencies, Housing Counselors, Real Estate Professionals, SMAs, MI Companies, Vendors and other industry organizations.

Freddie Mac educational resources and offerings are designed to bring all aspects of a topic into a comprehensive picture that includes technology, products, policy and process. Tapping into mortgage business expertise and innovative instructional design techniques, SSES helps Freddie Mac clients understand what they need to know and why it matters. The department delivers in-person and virtual instructor-facilitated training sessions and creates and provides ongoing updates for client on-demand tutorials, learning clips, job aids, online help, and webinar materials.

The team uses a consultative approach to complete role-based training needs assessments and training plans, design and develop content grounded in real-world scenarios, and focus on continuous improvement.

Qualifications:

At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Position Overview:

Are you looking to apply your extensive knowledge of Cybersecurity Risk to the financial services industry? We are seeking a highly skilled Cybersecurity Analyst with a proven understanding of the primary and secondary mortgage business, and a focus on third party risk management. You will implement and execute cyber and information risk oversight and control activities for the Single-Family division, collaborate with division leaders to assess risk, design, and implement appropriate security measures, coordinate remediation efforts, and consolidate the division’s information risk profile!

Our Impact:

Our third party cyber/information security risk management team embedded within the business provides proactive and reactive measures to manage cyber threats and crises effectively, by monitoring analyzing, identifying, and reporting risks on business operations, data integrity and divisional reputation, and then activating incident response plans as appropriate.

Your Impact:

Effective incident response engagement, effortsImplement and execute comprehensive information security strategies and protocols.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess and mitigate risks.Stay abreast of the latest cybersecurity threats, trends, and best practices.Investigate technological operational events and incidents.Conduct regular risk assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and gaps in existing third-party security risk and controls, and develop remediation plans as needed.Provide support to the team and leadership.Foster a culture of information security awareness and accountability.Collaborate effectively with partners, stakeholders, and the team.

Qualifications:

5+ years of experience working in and/or with information security, technology, incident management with a focus on the financial services industry, preferably in the mortgage sector.Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Cyber Security, Information Technology, or a related field; advanced degree preferred or equivalent experience.Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CRISC) preferred, with knowledge of NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology) Cybersecurity framework.Solid understanding of cybersecurity principles, practices, and technologies, including network security, endpoint protection, encryption, and identity and access management.Knowledge of security policy/ manuals and other guiding policy documentsUnderstanding of the primary and secondary mortgage business, including regulatory requirements, privacy protocols and industry standards (e.g., Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, CFPB).Perform analysis of third-party Cyber Security, Privacy review findingsPerform a security risk impact analysis and ensure security control accuracy and completeness.Proven record of accomplishment of implementing and executing risk strategies and protocols in sophisticated, highly regulated environments.Superb interpersonal presentation, communication skills, both written and verbal

Keys to Success in this Role:

Strong collaboration, communication skills with the ability to build connections, relationships across the organization, result driven and effective.Highly motivated and energetic self-starter with solid organizational and time management skillsExecution focused with proven initiative and personal accountability, and ownership.Critical thinking skills with a problem-solving mentality

Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.

Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Notice to External Search Firms: Freddie Mac partners with BountyJobs for contingency search business through outside firms. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit www.BountyJobs.com and register with our referral code: MAC.

Time-type:Full time

FLSA Status:Exempt

Freddie Mac offers a comprehensive total rewards package to include competitive compensation and market-leading benefit programs. Information on these benefit programs is available on our Careers site.

This position has an annualized market-based salary range of $105,000 - $157,000 and is eligible to participate in the annual incentive program. The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is dependent on various factors including but not limited to the responsibilities of the position, experience, skill set, internal pay equity and other relevant qualifications of the applicant.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
